item.title: AutoCache
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

okay i figured out how to fix that problem in the main class change method496 to this

    public void method496(ByteStream p) {
         int i = 0;
        do {
           i  = p.readUnByte();
            item.readDef(p, i);
        } while (i != 255);
    }

Read full topic

item.title: AutoCache
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Discount Waffles, post:6, topic:119351”]The last (NUMBER_OF_ITEMS * 4) + 1 bytes are the lengths of each substream in the file.

Pseudocode:

int[] startLocations = new int[NUMBER_OF_ITEMS]; int multiplier = stream.buffer[stream.buffer.length-1]; int startOfData = stream.buffer.length - NUMBER_OF_ITEMS * 4 * multiplier - 1; stream.pos = startOfData; int j = 0; for(int i = 0; i < NUMBER_OF_ITEMS; i++) { startLocations[i] = j; j += stream.readDWord(); } [/quote]

oh right that makes sense, i think i’ve seen that somewhere. however i think im issing the Number_of_items bit, is that located somewhere else, i know in the old engine their was numberOfItems right at the top of the file, im not 100 percent sure with new engine though.

Read full topic

item.title: AutoCache
item.dc:creator: @Discount_Waffles Discount Waffles
item.description:
@Discount_Waffles wrote:

The last (NUMBER_OF_ITEMS * 4) + 1 bytes are the lengths of each substream in the file.

Pseudocode:

int[] startLocations = new int[NUMBER_OF_ITEMS];
int multiplier = stream.buffer[stream.buffer.length-1];
int startOfData = stream.buffer.length - NUMBER_OF_ITEMS * 4 * multiplier - 1;
stream.pos = startOfData;
int j = 0;
for(int i = 0; i < NUMBER_OF_ITEMS; i++)
{
   startLocations[i] = j;
   j += stream.readDWord();
}

Read full topic

item.title: AutoCache
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

AutoCache app is a creation of boredom, it could use some work

What it does:

Connects - runescape update server
Downloads - cache peice that contains item information
Unpacks - the downloaded information into jag format
Reads information - Make sure to add the fix
source: http://dnd.no-ip.org/autocache/src.rar

[hr]
Add this fix
okay i figured out how to fix that problem in the main class change method496 to this

    public void method496(ByteStream p) {
         int i = 0;
        do {
           i  = p.readUnByte();
            item.readDef(p, i);
        } while (i != 255);
    }

Read full topic
